verses.verse: What <WG5101> shall we say <WG2046> then? <WG3767> Shall we continue <WG1961> in sin, <WG266> that grace <WG5485> may abound? <WG4121>
God <WG3361> <WG1096> forbid. <WG3361> <WG1096> How <WG4459> shall we, that are dead <WG599> to sin, <WG266> live <WG2198> any <WG2089> longer <WG2089> therein? <WG1722>
Know <WG50> you not, that so <WG3745> many <WG3745> of us as were baptized <WG907> into <WG1519> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> were baptized <WG907> into <WG1519> his death? <WG2288>

Therefore <WG3767> we are buried <WG4916> with him by baptism <WG908> into <WG1519> death: <WG2288> that like <WG5618> as Christ <WG5547> was raised <WG1453> up from the dead <WG3498> by the glory <WG1391> of the Father, <WG3962> even so <WG3779> we also <WG2532> should walk <WG4043> in newness <WG2538> of life. <WG2222>
For if <WG1487> we have been planted <WG4854> together <WG4854> in the likeness <WG3667> of his death, <WG2288> we shall be also <WG2532> in the likeness of his resurrection: <WG386>

Knowing <WG1097> this, <WG5124> that our old <WG3820> man <WG444> is crucified <WG4957> with him, that the body <WG4983> of sin <WG266> might be destroyed, <WG2673> that from now on <WG3371> we should not serve <WG1398> sin. <WG266>
For he that is dead <WG599> is freed <WG1344> from sin. <WG266>
Now <WG1161> if <WG1487> we be dead <WG599> with Christ, <WG5547> we believe <WG4100> that we shall also <WG2532> live <WG4800> with him:
Knowing <WG1492> that Christ <WG5547> being raised <WG1453> from the dead <WG3498> dies <WG599> no <WG3765> more; <WG2089> death <WG2288> has no <WG3765> more <WG3765> dominion <WG2961> over him.
For in that he died, <WG599> he died <WG599> to sin <WG266> once: <WG2178> but in that he lives, <WG2198> he lives <WG2198> to God. <WG2316>

Likewise <WG3779> reckon <WG3049> you also <WG2532> yourselves <WG1438> to be dead <WG3498> indeed <WG3303> to sin, <WG266> but alive <WG2198> to God <WG2316> through <WG1722> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> our Lord. <WG2962>
Let not sin <WG266> therefore <WG3767> reign <WG936> in your <WG5216> mortal <WG2349> body, <WG4983> that you should obey <WG5219> it in the lusts <WG1939> thereof. <WG846>

Neither <WG3366> yield <WG3936> you your <WG5216> members <WG3196> as instruments <WG3696> of unrighteousness <WG93> to sin: <WG266> but yield <WG3936> yourselves <WG1438> to God, <WG2316> as those that are alive <WG2198> from the dead, <WG3498> and your <WG5216> members <WG3196> as instruments <WG3696> of righteousness <WG1343> to God. <WG2316>
For sin <WG266> shall not have dominion <WG2961> over you: for you are not under <WG5259> the law, <WG3551> but under <WG5259> grace. <WG5485>
What <WG5101> then? <WG3767> shall we sin, <WG264> because <WG3754> we are not under <WG5259> the law, <WG3551> but under <WG5259> grace? <WG5485> God <WG3361> <WG1096> forbid. <WG3361> <WG1096>

Know <WG1492> you not, that to whom <WG3739> you yield <WG3936> yourselves <WG1438> servants <WG1401> to obey, <WG5218> his servants <WG1401> you are to whom <WG3739> you obey; <WG5219> whether <WG2273> of sin <WG266> to death, <WG2288> or <WG2228> of obedience <WG5218> to righteousness? <WG1343>

But God <WG2316> be thanked, <WG5485> that you were the servants <WG1401> of sin, <WG266> but you have obeyed <WG5219> from the heart <WG2588> that form <WG5179> of doctrine <WG1322> which <WG3739> was delivered <WG3860> you.
Being then <WG1161> made <WG1659> free <WG1659> from sin, <WG266> you became <WG1402> the servants <WG1402> of righteousness. <WG1343>

I speak <WG3004> after the manner <WG442> of men <WG442> because <WG1223> of the infirmity <WG769> of your <WG5216> flesh: <WG4561> for as you have yielded <WG3936> your <WG5216> members <WG3196> servants <WG1401> to uncleanness <WG167> and to iniquity <WG458> to iniquity; <WG458> even <WG3779> so <WG3779> now <WG3568> yield <WG3936> your <WG5216> members <WG3196> servants <WG1401> to righteousness <WG1343> to holiness. <WG38>
For when <WG3753> you were the servants <WG1401> of sin, <WG266> you were free <WG1658> from righteousness. <WG1343>

What <WG5101> fruit <WG2590> had <WG2192> you then <WG5119> <WG3767> in those things whereof <WG1909> <WG3739> you are now <WG3568> ashamed? <WG1870> for the end <WG5056> of those <WG1565> things is death. <WG2288>

But now <WG3570> being made <WG1659> free <WG1659> from sin, <WG266> and become <WG1402> servants <WG1402> to God, <WG2316> you have <WG2192> your <WG5216> fruit <WG2590> to holiness, <WG38> and the end <WG5056> everlasting <WG166> life. <WG2222>
For the wages <WG3800> of sin <WG266> is death; <WG2288> but the gift <WG5486> of God <WG2316> is eternal <WG166> life <WG2222> through <WG1722> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> our Lord. <WG2962>
